Package utils

Class ByteArray

java.lang.Object
utils.ByteArray
public class ByteArray extends Object
A dynamic array for storing bytes. Supports ordered and unordered storage.

    Constructor
    Description
    ByteArray()
    Creates an ordered array with a default capacity of 16.

    • ByteArray

      public ByteArray()
      Creates an ordered array with a default capacity of 16.

    • ByteArray

      public ByteArray(int capacity)
      Creates an ordered array with the specified capacity.
      Parameters:
      capacity - Initial capacity of the array.

    • ByteArray

      public ByteArray(boolean ordered, int capacity)
      Creates an array with the specified ordering and capacity.
      Parameters:
      ordered - If false, removing elements may change the order of other elements.
      capacity - Initial capacity of the array.

    • ByteArray

      public ByteArray(ByteArray array)
      Creates a new array by copying elements from the given array.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to copy elements from.

    • ByteArray

      public ByteArray(byte[] array)
      Creates a new ordered array by copying elements from the given native array.
      Parameters:
      array - The native array to copy elements from.

    • ByteArray

      public ByteArray(boolean ordered, byte[] array, int startIndex, int count)
      Creates a new array by copying a subset of elements from the given native array.
      Parameters:
      ordered - If false, removing elements may change the order of other elements.
      array - The native array to copy elements from.
      startIndex - The starting index to copy from.
      count - The number of elements to copy.

    • removeRange

      Parameters:
      start - The start index (inclusive).
      end - The end index (inclusive).
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If start or end are out of bounds.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the array.

    • shrink

      public byte[] shrink()
      Reduces the size of the backing array to the size of the actual items. This is useful to release memory when many items have been removed, or if it is known that more items will not be added.
      Returns:
      The backing array.

    • ensureCapacity

      public byte[] ensureCapacity(int additionalCapacity)
      Increases the size of the backing array to accommodate the specified number of additional items. Useful before adding many items to avoid multiple backing array resizes.
      Parameters:
      additionalCapacity - The additional capacity to ensure.
      Returns:
      The backing array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If additionalCapacity is negative.

    • setSize

      public byte[] setSize(int newSize)
      Sets the array size, leaving any values beyond the current size undefined.
      Parameters:
      newSize - The new size of the array.
      Returns:
      The backing array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If newSize is negative.

    • resize

      protected byte[] resize(int newSize)
      Resizes the internal array to the specified new size.
      Parameters:
      newSize - The new size for the internal array.
      Returns:
      The resized internal array.

      public void sort()
      Sorts the array in ascending order.

    • reverse

      public void reverse()
      Reverses the order of elements in the array.

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      Shuffles the elements in the array randomly.

    • truncate

      public void truncate(int newSize)
      Reduces the size of the array to the specified size. If the array is already smaller than the specified size, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      newSize - The new size for the array.

    • random

      public byte random()
      Returns a random item from the array, or zero if the array is empty.
      Returns:
      A random item from the array, or zero if the array is empty.

      Converts the array to a new byte array.
      Returns:
